subject: RE: [junit] Question about Interdependent Test Cases

messageBody:
> From: Leonardo Abreu de Barros [mailto:leobarros@...]

> I have a simple question about arranging related tests inside a test
> case:
>
> - Let`s say I have three tests that in some way depend on each other:
> for example, a creation, a getter and a deletion method.
> These are distinct functionalities, and thus deserve to be on
> separate tests. The problem is: if one fails, the other two will run
> anyway. But if the creation or getter methods fail, it doesn`t make
> sense for me to test the deletion method, as it depends on the
> correctness of the other two. I know calling one test inside another
> is not recommended. What should I do in this case?

Put the assertions for all 3 responsibilities in one test method. If the first one fails, the whole method fails. Call it testCRUD().

If you insist on testing them as distinct functions in distinct tests, then duplicate the test fixture for each one. If they do not always fail together, then this makes sense.

But if they are distinct, yet always fail together because they are interdependent, put them all in the same test method.

Scott Stirling
